pages.text: $(#734608)Over the years, I’ve seen at least a dozen different $(thing)goblin$() $(#734608)cultures. Most of them have different traditions and even worship different gods, but all of them have one thing in common - they hate the sun. But thousands of years ago when the $(thing)arcane barrier$() $(#734608)appeared deep underground, many goblins were trapped in the dark below,$()

pages.title: Summoning Totem
pages.text: $(#734608)in a place where the shadows “breed” and “live”, with no way to return. The goblins I met told me that in such dire circumstances, even the least devout survivor would have sought aid from  “Uyalokura”, $(thing)the prince of the sun.$()

$(thing)Goblin shamans$() $(#734608)imbue magic into the $(thing)idols$() $(#734608)of their gods, just like villagers create golems in their own image. The shamans claim these idols inherit some of the powers of the deities they’re meant to represent and venerate. I wish I had that kind of faith in myself!$()
